subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Kevin Harvick won another race and the runaway points leader Carl Edwards wrapped up his first Nascar Busch Series championship yesterday at Texas Motor Speedway in Fort Worth. Edwards, who built a lead of more than 800 points in the first half of the season, put away the title with an 11th-place run in the O’Reilly Challenge. He leads the runner-up David Reutimann by an insurmountable 552 points with two races to go. Harvick, running a limited Busch schedule this season after his runaway title in 2006, won for a series-high sixth time in 24 starts in 2007.
